009package imagingbook.common.math;
010
011import static org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition.DEFAULT_ABSOLUTE_POSITIVITY_THRESHOLD;
012import static org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition.DEFAULT_RELATIVE_SYMMETRY_THRESHOLD;
013
014import java.util.Arrays;
015
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
017//import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
018import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
024import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
025
026/**
027 * Solves the generalized symmetric eigenproblem of the form A x = &lambda; B x,
028 * where matrices A, B are symmetric and B is positive definite
029 * (see Sec. 11.0.5. of [1]).
030 * The methods defined by this class are analogous to the conventional
031 * eigendecomposition (see {@link EigenDecomposition}).
032 * 
033 * <p>
034 * [1] Press, Teukolsky, Vetterling, Flannery:
035 * "Numerical Recipes". Cambridge University Press, 3rd ed. (2007).
036 * </p>
037 * @see GeneralizedEigenDecomposition
038 * @see EigenvalueDecomposition
039 * @author WB
040 * @version 2022/06/11
041 */
042public class GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition {
043        
044        private final EigenDecomposition eigendecompY;
045        private final DecompositionSolver solverLT;
046        
047        /**
048         * Constructor.
049         * An exception is thrown if A is not symmetric and
050         * the Cholesky decomposition throws an exception if B is either not symmetric,
051         * not positive definite or singular.
052         * 
053         * @param A real symmetric matrix
054         * @param B real symmetric and positive definite matrix
055         * @param rsth  relative symmetry threshold
056         * @param apth absolute positivity threshold
057         */
058        public GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition(RealMatrix A, RealMatrix B, double rsth, double apth) {
059                if (!MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(A, rsth)) {
060                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix A must be symmetric");
061                }
062                
063                if (!MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(B, rsth)) {
064                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix B must be symmetric");
065                }
066                
067                CholeskyDecomposition cd = null;
068                try {
069                        cd = new CholeskyDecomposition(B, rsth, apth);
070                } catch (NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException e) {
071                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix B must be positive definite");
072                }
073
074                RealMatrix L = cd.getL();
075
076                // find Q, such that Q * LT = A or equivalently L * QT = AT = A (since A is symmetric)
077                DecompositionSolver sL = new LUDecomposition(L).getSolver();
078                RealMatrix Q = sL.solve(A);
079
080                // find Y, such that L * Y = QT
081                RealMatrix Y = sL.solve(Q.transpose());
082                
083                // Y has the same eigenvalues as the original system and eigenvectors v_k
084                this.eigendecompY = new EigenDecomposition(Y);
085                
086                // the eigenvectors x_k of the original system are related
087                // to the eigenvectors v_k of Y as x_k = (LT)^(-1) * v_k = (L^(-1))^T * v_k
088                // or found by solving L^T * x_k = y_k, using the following solver:
089                this.solverLT = new LUDecomposition(cd.getLT()).getSolver();
090        }
091        
092        /**
093         * Constructor.
094         * 
095         * @param A real symmetric matrix
096         * @param B real symmetric and positive definite matrix
097         */
098        public GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition(RealMatrix A, RealMatrix B) {
099                this(A, B, 
100                                DEFAULT_RELATIVE_SYMMETRY_THRESHOLD, 
101                                DEFAULT_ABSOLUTE_POSITIVITY_THRESHOLD);
102        }
103        
104        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
105        
106        public double[] getRealEigenvalues() {
107                return eigendecompY.getRealEigenvalues();
108        }
109        
110        public double[] getImagEigenvalues() {
111                return eigendecompY.getImagEigenvalues();
112        }
113        
114        public boolean hasComplexEigenvalues() {
115                return eigendecompY.hasComplexEigenvalues();
116        }
117        
118        public RealMatrix getD() {
119                return eigendecompY.getD();
120        }
121        
122        public RealVector getEigenvector(int k) {
123//              return LiT.operate(ed.getEigenvector(k));
124                // solve LT * x_k = v_k
125                RealVector vk = eigendecompY.getEigenvector(k);
126                return solverLT.solve(vk);
127        }
128
129        public RealMatrix getV() {
130//              return LiT.multiply(ed.getV());
131                // solve LT * X = V
132                return solverLT.solve(eigendecompY.getV());
133        }
134
135        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
136        
137        public static void main(String[] args) {
138                PrintPrecision.set(9);
139                
140                RealMatrix A = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] {
141                        { 3,  -1,  5},
142                        { -1,  -2, 7},
143                        { 5,  7,  0}});
144                
145                RealMatrix B = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] {
146                        { 10, 2,  7},
147                        {  2, 12, 3},
148                        {  7, 3, 15}});
149                
150                GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition solver = new GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition(A, B);
151                
152                System.out.println("has complex eigenvalues = " + solver.hasComplexEigenvalues());
153                double[] evals = solver.getRealEigenvalues();
154                System.out.println("evals = " + Arrays.toString(evals));
155                
156                for (int k = 0; k < evals.length; k++) {
157                        double lambda = evals[k];
158                        RealVector evec = solver.getEigenvector(k);
159                        RealVector evecn = normalize(evec);
160                        System.out.println("k = " + k);
161                        System.out.println("  eval = " + lambda);
162                        System.out.println("  evec = " + Matrix.toString(evec));
163                        System.out.println("  evecn = " + Matrix.toString(evecn));
164                        
165                        RealVector L = A.operate(evecn);
166                        System.out.println("L = "+ Arrays.toString(L.toArray()));
167                        
168                        RealVector R = B.operate(evecn).mapMultiply(lambda);
169                        System.out.println("R = "+ Arrays.toString(R.toArray()));
170                        
171                        RealVector res = L.subtract(R);
172                        //System.out.println("res = "+ Arrays.toString(res.toArray())); // L - R must be 0
173                        System.out.println("  res = 0? "+  Matrix.isZero(res.toArray(), 1e-6));
174                }
175                
176                RealMatrix V = solver.getV();
177                System.out.println("V = \n" + Matrix.toString(V.getData()));
178                RealMatrix D = solver.getD();
179                System.out.println("D = \n" + Matrix.toString(D.getData()));
180                
181                // check A*V = B*V*D
182                RealMatrix AV = A.multiply(V);
183                System.out.println("AV = \n" + Matrix.toString(AV.getData()));
184                RealMatrix BVD = B.multiply(V).multiply(D);
185                System.out.println("BVD = \n" + Matrix.toString(BVD.getData()));
186                
187                // normalize V:
188                // each eigenvector is normalized so that the modulus of its largest component is 1.0 .
189                for (int k = 0; k < evals.length; k++) {
190                        V.setColumn(k, normalize(V.getColumn(k)));
191                }
192                System.out.println("V normalized = \n" + Matrix.toString(V.getData()));
193                
194        }
195        
196        static RealVector normalize(RealVector x) {
197                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(normalize(x.toArray()));
198        }
199        
200        static double[] normalize(double[] x) {
201                int n = x.length;
202                double[] y = new double[n];
203                double maxval = -1;
204                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
205                        maxval = Math.max(maxval, Math.abs(x[i]));
206                }
207                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
208                        y[i] = x[i] / maxval;
209                }
210                return y;
211        }
212}
